values:
So my show Dames at Sea is coming up and you should all come.  I play Joan the sassy and brassy chorus girl!  It's kind of a different part for me (even though I connect with it a lot better than all those ingenues haha).  For those of you who know Ari, she is also in at as Ruby.

It's June 15-16, 22-24, 29-30, and July 1

If you want ticket info: http://www.montgomerycollege.edu/departments/auxiliaryservices/summerdinnertheatre/index_1024_768.htm

Also, if you don't want dinner and want to pay much less and don't mind sitting closer to the back, you can come at the door an hour before curtain and get in for $10.
I'm doing pointless stuff on a pointless snow day. :-)

My Catholic audition went great!  A lot better than I was anticipating.  I did screw up my dance UNBELIEVABLY but it was because the floor was linoleum and super slippery and they were said it was ok they knew it was really slippery.  I also messed up my monologues a bit but I think I covered that alright.  Jane liked my cat dissection monologue.  She said she did the same thing with a squirrel when she was a kid...disgusting...  She was cool, I liked her.  They were a lot friendlier than any other college audition I've been to so far except maybe the theater director at OCU.  They were about as friendly as he was.  I think they liked my singing.  Hopefully I get in because I really really liked the school a lot.


I think I'm going to Songs For a New World auditions on Wednesday, but I have to see if I can actually get there because my dad's going on a business trip and we might only have one car.

And then Penn State next Saturday.

sheesh!  So many auditions!

On the way to the metro we passed a street called no joke Morning Wood Drive.  hahaha I have a twelve year old sense of humor.

CONCERT FOR HEAT!
Saturday January 21 
at Damascus Performing Arts Center (9815 Main Street, Damascus, MD 20872)
at 7:30
Tickets are $15 at the door and $10 in advance
call 917-251-7866 to reserve tickets

We're trying to raise $3000 to pay for heat at DPAC.  For the past few years we've been dancing and performing in the cold which is not very fun.  I know $15 is a lot for a concert, but it's really for a good cause.  The show is really cute and there are a lot of great and funny numbers.  The first act is all songs about the cold and the second act is all songs about the heat.  It's fun.  So come see it!  :-)

I got $5,500 per year for academics and community service for Point Park.  I gotta schedule my audition now.  Although looking at this brochure I got, it looks like this school's program is a tough one.
oh la la! un, deux, trois, qautre, cinq, six, sept, weeeeeeeee! Us utensils are sad because we haven't been serving.

Ground Rules: The first player of this "game" starts with the topic "5 weird habits of yours" and people who get tagged need to write an LJ entry about their 5 quirky habits as well as state this rule clearly. In the end, you need to choose the next 5 people to be tagged and list their names.

1. In order to sleep at night, I have to cover my face completely with the blanket and stretch my arms above my head.

2. When I want to practice singing, I put the tracking cd in the stereo in our computer room, turn it up really loud, and then go in the bathroom and sing.  The accoustics are better and I can see my facials and what I need to work on.

3. Right before I become relaxed, my brow gathers and I purse my lips so it looks like I'm thinking about something really hard when I'm actually not.

4. I crack my ankles.

5. I have to at least get my hair wet if not wash it when I come home from school or else I feel dirty.

I tag Amanda, Shana, Corri, Hannah, and whoever else wants to do it.

Don't mind me. I'm just avoiding studying for speech finals. Total comments: 815

These statistics were generated using LJ Stats. Original idea from 's LJ Comment Stats Wizard. 1. Initials: MEL 2. Name someone with the same birthday as you: Kirsten. And I just found out Kristen Chenoweth was born on July 24. It would be cool except I've lost all respect for her after those insipid Old Navy commercials. 3. Where was your last kiss?: In Dani's basement at the Carousel cast party. Why am I so pathetic? 4. For or against same sex marriage?: FOR! 5. Are you homophobic?: no way jose 7. Do you believe in God?: yes. I definately believe in a higher power. Now heaven and hell and all that jazz I'm not so sure. 8. How many US states have you been to?: not very many 9. How many of the US states have you lived in?: 1 10. Have you ever lived outside the US?: nope 11. Name something you like physically about yourself: my calves are really strong 12. Name something non physical you like about yourself: I hate giving up. 13. How do you know you don't like something until you try it?: you don't 14. What is the current rumor traveling around about you?: no clue 15. What do you think about drugs?: they are bad 16. Have you ever had someone of the opposite sex stay over at your house?: I don't think so. 17. How many concerts have you gone to?: a few 18. Do you download music?: on itunes 19. How many illegal things have you done?: not that many 20. Would you date the person who posted this?: don't swing that way 21. Has anyone ever sang or played for you personally?: I wish. 23. Ever been kissed under fireworks?: I wish again. 24. Do you like president Bush?: no 25. Have you ever bungee jumped?: no but that would be kind of cool 26. Have you ever white-water rafted?: no, but again that would be cool 27. Have you ever gotten in a wreck?: nope 28. Has anyone more than 10 years older than you hit on you?: I'm with Amanda. Those Spanish guys who drive by in trucks and honk at you. 29. Have you met a real redneck?: I danced with one at the real nice clambake! 30. Do you have romantic feelings for someone at this time?: I have them for two people. silly me. 31. What are you listening to right now?: nothing 32. What is your current favorite song?: Christmas carols 33. What was the last movie you watched?: Pay It Forward 34. Who was the last person that told you they loved you?: don't know 35. Where was the last place you were at besides your house: Act 2 36. Have you ever seriously vandalized someone else's property?: no 37. Have you ever hit someone of the opposite sex?: probably 45. Do you have an I-Pod: yes. it's pink and pretty. 46. Has anyone ever said you looked like a celebrity?: Shirley Temple if she still counts as a celebrity 47. Do you still watch kiddy movies or TV shows?: I watched the Lizzie McGuire movie a few weeks ago 48. Do you have braces?: nope 49. Are you comfortable with your height?: it's ok 51. When do you know its love?: you don't. That's why people get so confused and heartbroken. 52. Do you speak any other languages besides English?: no. 53. What kind of alcohol do you enjoy while out?: I don't like alchohol. 55. Have you ever ridden in a limo?: no 56. Has anyone you were close with passed away?: yes 58. What's something that really annoys you?: wonder boy soprano from Beauty and the Beast who's in pre-algebra and knows scientific notation. 59. What's something you really like?: musicals 60. Do you like Michael Jackson?: I have to admit, his music is pretty good. 61. Can you dance?: enough to get by 62. Have you ever surfed?: no but I want to 63. Do you know how to pump gas?: actually no. I really need to learn. 64. Do you drive?: yes 65. What's the latest you have ever stayed up?: all night 66. Have you ever thought you were honestly going to die?: several times. I tend to panic in totally irrational situations. I can find a way to make anywhere dangerous. 67. Were you ever rushed by an ambulance into the emergency room?: no 68. Have you ever been dared to do something you didn't want to do? more times than I can count 69. What do you think of the person who posted this before you?: She's too awesome for words! :-)

List ten things that make you happy (in no particular order), and then tag five people to do the same...

1. sending in college applications, that is a VERY good feeling
2. snowflakes in my hair
3. going to my see my friends in their shows
4. belting out the Christmas carols on the radio when I'm in the car alone
5. being cold and then getting under the covers
6. Ms. White modeling at the talent show last night
7. the Uno club
8. Shakespeare
9. hot chocolate
10. puppies and kittens

I'm not tagging since I wasn't technically tagged myself.

That just made me really happy.

You have one more chance to see Carousel today at 3.  Please come and I'll be your best friend.

This is just a friendly reminder that you should come see Carousel. You have 3 more chances. This Friday and Saturday at 8 and this Sunday at 3. http://www.damascustheatre.org I would advise you buy tickets ahead of time. We haven't sold out yet ,but you never know. I wouldn't want you to drive all the way to Cowtown, USA and then not be able to see the show. Here's a pretty picture to look at...

Created by Grahame
That's the funniest I got. And the one on my xanga about ghs' gospel choir doing a salsa.

Wow I had a lot of fun at DPAC tonight.

Like I really liked listening to the singers and crap.  I think my favorite was Being Alive sung by the multitalented Bill Brown with Sam Kelvie singing As Long As He Needs Me in a close second.  beauteous...  euphonious to my ears!  I'm trying out vocab haha.

It's still like 1 degree in there.  Please have heat tomorrow...  pleasssseeeeeeeeeee.

So basically rehearsal was a train wreck today.  Just...everything went wrong.

And I probably look like a huge bitch now because I got pretty frustrated with the music.  Because people are leaving out rests and crap and the song sounds like its in the wrong key and everything.  And I've heard that song about 29830810928390850989021838058098219389081230912849085908098234 times so it baffles me that people don't get it.  But I guess I can't really think that because a lot of them have never heard it before.  I guess I assume since I know the song so well and I know a LOT of people who know the song as well or better than I do, that EVERYONE does which apparently is not true.  hahaha

It got a little better when we danced.  Although it was not terrifically exciting walking around in a circle for 10 minutes straight.  

Me and Danielle kept saying it would have been SO much more productive if we did blocking today.  

but whatever...  it'll come through.  I think part of it is that MTI hasn't sent the score yet.  bah

I still needa know what time to go to DPAC tomorrowwwwwwwwwww.  If no one knows I'll just show up at 7:30 and hope there's people there haha.  It better be warmer than 2 degrees too.  haha

I love it when I have totally WONDERFUL conversations with people and you talk about EVERYTHING.  and like you feel like you've connected with that person.  I love that.

hahaha that last thing was bordering on cryptic.  Oh cryptic posts...  I have a love/hate relationship with them.

hahaha sometimes I read over my entries and I have no idea how I got from talking about one thing to another. 

ok I'm done.

I have a feeling this show will bring me a whole lot of stress.  Actually I'm 21380982390890890284908% sure it will.  fantastic...

sucks because I'm in love with my part.  really...

but whatever.  

whoa I have no idea what time were supposed to be at DPAC on friday?  anyone?  that's gonna be a busy day...

Ok question: do you think it's worth it to study for the SATs?  Because I have them in a little less them 2 weeks and I've been studying vocab and doing practice tests for critical reading and crap and then Mr. Fleming pointed out to me that there's really no point because it measures aptitude and you either know the word or you don't.  Which makes kind of perfect sense...  So is it worth it?  

my entries get more and more pointless every day...

Today was kind of boring.  But I was really glad it was a snow day because I really needed a day off.

I got a head start on my outline for the research paper.  I'm nowhere near finishing it ,but I got started which is good right?  I might change the order though actually.

I kind of hope there is school tomorrow ,because we're supposed to do some more blocking for Fiddler and I don't want blocking to last any longer than it absolutely has to.  I hate blocking.  If I ever direct a show I think I'll just tell the actors to go wherever they want.  Although that would be a disaster lol.

A 2 hr delay would be nice...

ok yeah I'm done now...

I got Chava!!!!!!  Sooooo excited.  I love being cast outside of my typical soprano lovey-dovey ingenue typecast.  It brings me great joy.  And I get a dance solo which is my dream.  No joke...

Amanda got Yente obviously!  haha YAAAAAAAAAAAAY!

And Danielle is Hodel so maybe now Keith and Bill will actually come to my shows since they know THREE people in it lol.

The cast is...interesting.  In the true spirit of a GHS show Tevye is hispanic.  joy!  And he apparently has a thick accent too.  Amazing...

I am cast opposite of Jason Waters.  uh...  fun.  hahaha a black Russian!  bahahahahaha

and of course the Mike Luu DOES get to be an asian jew (he's Perchik).  SWEET!

I'm very excited.

Camille, Mr. Fleming said he was looking for a choreographer and I dropped him your name and told him you'd choreographed it before and he said to come see him.  SO DO IT!!!  lol that would be so cool.  :-)

Fiddler auditions were fun.  I'm not really sure how I did.  I think it was just so so.  Nothing really special.  But I had a blast which is rare at an audition.  I usually HATE them but this one was so much fun.

First Mr. Fleming had me read TOTALLY out of my type cast...for Yente.  bahahahahaha.  And of course I sucked ,but I don't mind.  I tried.  This just proves that I am destined to play the boring little ingenue forever and ever and ever.  And then I read for Tzeitel and that's all the reading I did.

It was really nice to see Ms. Berlin again.  She is a really nice lady.  although it kind of made me nervous that she recorded us.  Ah well.  I think singing was ok.  Not my best.  I have a little bit of a cough though.

Then we danced.  And the dance was outrageously simple ,but no one could do it which was REALLY funny.  Like REALLY funny.  It was basically just a grapevine, snap, and turn around lol.  But everyone was like falling over their own feet.  This amused me greatly.

Um...  Amanda's Yente voice was PRICELESS.  I was laughing SO hard.  If she gets that part (which I'm pretty certain she will) she will STEAL THE SHOW.  Because it was seriously SO funny.  

Um then after I just kinda hung around doing crazy stuff.  Like hitting each other with a GHS Trojans thunder stick (????) and belting out Sh-boom at the top of my lungs (and Stephanie Fillmore joined in!  AWESOME!)

Phil sang I'm a little teapot which is really cool.

Um...  So I'm also thinking Barry will end up as Tevye.  yes?  no?  thoughts?  yeah I think so...

um ok I'm done...

I think I'm getting a cold.  If there's anything I hate more in the world it's colds.  Especially since they always pop up at the absolute worst times.  Like when I have an audition in two days.  oh joy.  

Um...  Forget my reading for Company.  I got forgotten apparently...  oh well!  Congrats Katie!  :-D

I'm officially incredibly pissed off at the county for making us write a stupid essay about student service learning AT THE SAME TIME AS OUR STUPID 11TH GRADE RESEARCH PAPER!  GODDDDDDDDDDD!  Can you be any more annoying?  The upside is we get 1 whole ssl hour.  whoopdedoo.  

I also could care less whether or not Huck Finn is taught in schools.  Why must I write a 10 page paper on it?!  WHY?!  WHY WHY WHY WHY WHY!?!?!?!??!  And why are the stupid parents from that video so spazzy about the book?  Yeah they use the n word in like every sentence but it's a satire!  Mark Twain was not racist you IDIOTS.  He was the COMPLETE opposite.  People are so stupid it hurts me.

I hate school...

I miss sitting with Andrew Breiner and Rick Phillips and Sean Reiley in Physics.  I know that sounds crazy but we had crazy deep philosophical discussions about life and religion and everything.  MUCH more interesting than physics.  Now I sit with these other girls who do their work on time and always go up to ask mr. caretti questions every millisecond.

Everything would be peachy keen if it was summer right now.  Yeah...  

which reminds me...

DTC is doing Carousel for their summer/fall show.  Do you think I can handle two Carousels at once?  Like would I get the dances mixed up?  lol.  DISCUSS!

um...  ok now I'm gonna go freak out about this cold I feel comming on and drink 123908019289080948912308 glasses of orange juice.  That's the true mary beth spirit!  :-D

Valentine's Day is comming up and we started talking about what true love is in church today.  I know it really has NOTHING to do with God or anything church related ,but it was a really good discussion and I started to realize things.

I think I realized why so many people think teenagers can't experience real love.  Because now that I have a better sense of what it is I realize that there are VERY few teenagers who actually have it.

We talked about the difference between love and lust.  Real love and infatuation.  The definition Kevin gave us of true love was to be able to say I love you period.  Not I love you if or I love you because.

The difference between lust and love is that love is giving lust is taking.  I mean I can think of very few teenagers who don't want something from their boyfriend or girlfriend or crush.  We always want them to kiss us or write us a nice little note or show us off to the world.  Or we want someone to send us a Valentine or a rose or candy.  And most of all we get jealous.  (I know this is all kind of a stereotype and doesn't apply to everyone but I've met A LOT of people like this...)  What I realized today is that's not love.  That's infatuation.  Love is doing something for the other person without thinking of yourself at all.  Even if that means giving him or her up.  Love is being willing to walk 1000 miles without ever expecting a single kiss.  Love is running in front of a speeding bullet to save someone not thinking of your own life and everything you might miss out on.  It's not a box of candy, or a card, or a date, or a love note, or a poem, or holding hands in the hallways.

True love is completely selfless.  I think there are very few people in this world who can say they have that.  Because I really think humans are naturally selfish creatures.  We sort of fall in love with love.  We watch those romance films and keep wishing we had that.  Someone who really cared for us.  I do it myself.  In fact now that I think about it I realize it's a huge fault of mine.  I constantly mope about how I don't have anyone.  

Kevin told us that his definition of true love is the same as the police man's motto: to protect and to serve.  That makes a whole lot of sense to me.

And I don't really know where I'm going with all this ,but I wanted to share it with you.

I guess what I want to say is don't jump too quickly to that conclusion that you're in love.  When you can willingly step in front of a bullet to save a friend, boyfriend/girlfriend, or crush THAT is love.  

So with that said, just enjoy Valentine's Day for the cheesy hallmark holiday it is.  Eat your candy because it tastes good not because it says I love you across it.  






I have a feeling this entry is gonna piss people off lol.  But oh well I thought Kevin made a lot of sense.

I was in a really good mood today because of Gilmore Girls yesterday and Luke and Lorelai KISSED and it was perfect.  lol.  TV is brainwashing me.  I got really happy over fictitional characters on a tv show.  WEIRD!  But now I'm pissed off because they're starting back at the beginning of season 1 which makes me mad.  I should really watch the REAL show and not the reruns.  I think I will.  Although I'm sure it's all downhill after Rory and Dean had sex (??????????????????).  It's gonna turn into a soap opera I can see it comming.  Aww its a shame.  That show is SO funny and now its ruined by sex.  

So we had an assembly today about African American History Month.  It was pretty cool.  I found it pretty funny that we have one random white guy in the school gospel choir.  lol!!!  They did a play on Martin Luther King and Malcolm X ,and the actors were good but they didn't project or annunciate so I had no clue what they were saying.  And it lasted forEVER.  And it was just dialogue so after a while it got painfully boring.  

But then our whole schedule got thrown off from that.  We ended up missing third and fourth (YES NO FRENCH!) and then 10 minutes off of every class in the afternoon.  That was nice.  It should've been no school today.  In my opinion...

I'm auditioning for Fiddler on Thursday.  But apparently no one is auditioning that day because they wanna see the powder puff game.  lol I picked Thursday because I'm impatient and I know if I wait for the audition I won't have to wait as long for the cast list lol!  Like everyone who I've talked to is definately not singing a song from a musical.  So everyone's gonna be singing like pop and stuff except Mary Beth who will be singing her boring high soprano showtune ballads.  I want an uptempo.  I'm sick of ballads they're boring.  Although I guess ballads are kind of appropriate for a show like Fiddler on the Roof.

ok that's all...

Whoaaaaaaaaaa.  Gimore Girls reruns today was INTENSE.  Although I already knew cuz Sarah told me on the bus lol.  But still....  CRAZY!

Gilmore Girls is my new 7th Heaven.  I've now realized that the actors on 7th Heaven are TERRIBLE and need some serious acting lessons and Gilmore Girls is SO much better.  So now I'm addicted.  Lorelai, please be my mother.  

I've really started speaking Mary Beth/Phil language.  Like I really find myself typing that is so "master" and totally "coolur"!  and I'm like oh my god I am a huge loser.  

But really I think master should be made a really word.  It flows nice.  Soooooo master.  Reminds me of sooooooooooo fetch.  lol.

Ok I'll stop.  I'm  a big dork.

Hey what time's this thing for dance on Saturday?  I forgot already...

I've hit this point where honestly NOTHING exciting ever happens.

For the past few months it's just been like the same thing every single day.  It's like I wake up I go to school I come home I do my homework I eat I sleep I repeat the cycle.  Over and over and over again.  Sometimes it feels like the same day.  Like even though its wednesday today, today was exactly the same as tuesday so I mean it's really kinda hard to remember its wednesday.

wow...

This is horribly dull.  I need some excitement VERY badly.

I hope Keith remembered to call Lee.

And I hope Lee wants to hear me read/sing.

I'm waiting for Keith to call me.  call meeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee.

I officially feel EXTREMELY bad because we couldn't get out of the house today to go to church because of the ice and its the last time bill is preaching.  I know it's not my fault but I feel like a very bad person.

ok I'm done...

So I'm gonna read for Kathy in Company ,because they haven't cast the part yet.  yeah...

Um I know nothing about this show...  So I don't know what to do.  lol

I actually still don't know when I'm going to read.  Keith's calling Lee and then he's gonna call me back.  yeah...

But apparently my competition is the super talented Katie Mays.  Which basically means I won't get this part.  But I might as well try anyways.  I actually don't think I would mind much if I didn't get it.  I always have the school show too.  yeah...  And Katie's awesome so it wouldn't bother me.

So yeah that's my story.

Um...  if you know this show...  help!?  lol

Open your iTunes and set it to shuffle. Pick 20 songs, and write down a song lyric that you like or connect with. Don't write the title or artist, and see if you're friends recognize your music!

1. I'm tired of lookin round rooms wondering what I've gotta do or who I'm supposed to be.  I don't wanna be anything other than me.

2. I will not give up hope I was hooked from the start when I noticed your kind and your powerful heart.

3. What will happen to a face in the crowd when it finally gets too crowded?

4. Say you'll never let me go cause I've gone long enough waiting for wonderful.

5. Hundreds of flowers in full bloom!  Hundreds of people in each room!

6. The only love I ever knew, I threw it all away.

7. I know a girl, a girl with so much luck she could get run over by a two ton truck and brush herself off and walk away how she does it?  Couldn't say...

8. Sunshine, I'm beginning to like this.

9. I'm just a shadow upon these walls.  I'm living proof of the damage heartbreak does.

10. There's a place for us, a time and place for us.  Hold my hand and we're halfway there, hold my hand and I'll take you there.

11. I have nothing more to say to you...

12. Look at the sky baby see how it cries.  Ain't it just like my tears?  Falling down like rain on the ground everytime you say goodbye.

13. Ask me something easier, a smile, a kiss.  Look I'll give you anything but don't ask me this.

14. Lie in my arms while you're sleeping and think of the rivers you've crossed.  I'll tell you the dreams I've been keeping for moments like this when your hope is lost.

15. Aphrodite don't forget me, Romeo and Juliet me!

16. I'm kinda pretty and pretty damn smart.  I like romantic things like music and art.  And as you know I have a gigantic heart so why don't I have a boyfriend  IT SUCKS TO BE ME!  (hahahah this one officially makes me look completely nuts to anyone who doesn't like musicals)

17. If I could dance with you today.  Who cares what all those folks will say?  Your husband's fine its true but I'm the lucky who gets to dance with you so turn an ankle and let that music play!

18. I love him ,because he's...I don't know.  Because he's just my Bill.

19. Where have you been my long lost friend?  It's good to see you again.  Come and sit for a while I've missed your smile.

20. Am I not pretty enough?  Is my heart too broken?  Do I cry too much?  Am I too outspoken?  Don't I make you laugh?  Should I try it harder?



Gosh that is quite possibly the most random list of songs EVER.  

And what's so funny is like 9 of those are from musicals.  hahaha.  Actually it might be 10 cuz one is a jazz song but I'm pretty sure it's in a musical too.  

I bet you can't guess them.

Here I go and there's no turning back, 
my great adventure has begun.
I may be small 
But I've got giant plans,
to shine as brightly as the sun!
I will blaze until I find my time and place.
I will be fearless surrendering modesty and grace.
I will not disappear without a trace!
I'll shout and start a riot, be anything but quiet!
Christopher Columbus I will be...
Astonishing
Astonishing
Astonishing at last!


I would really like to do a musical right about now.  Yeah that would be great.

Why does nothing exciting ever happen to me?

Um...  weird.

So one of my mom's best friends who she worked with for many years has a son named Steve (he goes to Sherwood so I'm sure some of you know him...) and we used to play together when we were like 7.  Yeah and he had like 219038908120398095809810238981290380948 baseball cards and he showed me all of them and yeah.  We kept each other company while our moms did stupid boring kindergarten stuff at the end of the summer.

Yeah he was on Jepoardy.  Freaking awesome!  And what's even cooler?  

HE WON!!!!

WEIRDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD

lol

I haven't seen him in a bajillion years.

now he's rich...

ok that's my story for today...

So yeah I am SUPER bored.

Dance was cancelled today so that's 3 straight days of doing absolutely nothing.  fun.

I did play some more stupid games on yahoo.  lol.  Those are so stupid and brainwashing.

I'm sort of excited for second semester to start ,because I like a change every now and then.  I just hope I have some people in my classes.  That would suck so much if I didn't.

GOD I'M BOREDDDDDDDD!

I just watched Mean Girls for the first time and it was so funny.

hahaha I loved it!
